template.description: A series of disconnected flows which demonstrates different functionality of the FetchElasticSearch and PutElasticSearch processors.
template.name: ElasticsearchDemonstration

labels.label: The flow below gets documents from Elasticsearch. Specify the ID to retrieve. This can be done dynamically by sending FlowFiles, each with an attribute containing the ID, then using Expression Language in the FetchElasticsearch processor to refer to the attribute. This example uses the mod() operator to get IDs from 0 to 9.
The process group below (PutES) gets random user data from a public API, then inserts each user document into Elasticsearch

This flow uses InvokeHttp to call the Elasticsearch Search API to retrieve all document IDs for users who are female. FetchElasticsearch is then used to retrieve those documents and write them to disk.
This flow gets random user data from a public API, then inserts each user document into Elasticsearch

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: HTTP request method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS). Arbitrary methods are also supported. Methods other than POST and PUT will be sent without a message body.
value.name: HTTP Method

value.description: Remote URL which will be connected to, including scheme, host, port, path.
value.name: Remote URL

value.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL (https) connections.
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Max wait time for connection to remote service.
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: Max wait time for response from remote service.
value.name: Read Timeout

value.description: Include an RFC-2616 Date header in the request.
value.name: Include Date Header

value.description: Follow HTTP redirects issued by remote server.
value.name: Follow Redirects

value.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers. Also any dynamic properties set will be sent as headers. The dynamic property key will be the header key and the dynamic property value will be interpreted as expression language will be the header value.
value.name: Attributes to Send

value.description: The username to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL. Cannot include control characters (0-31), ':', or DEL (127).
value.name: Basic Authentication Username

value.description: The password to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.
value.name: Basic Authentication Password

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

value.description: If set, the response body received back will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.
value.name: Put Response Body In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: If routing the response body to an attribute of the original (by setting the "Put response body in attribute" property or by receiving an error status code), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.
value.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: Whether to communicate with the website using Digest Authentication. 'Basic Authentication Username' and 'Basic Authentication Password' are used for authentication.
value.name: Digest Authentication

value.description: Will force a response FlowFile to be generated and routed to the 'Response' relationship regardless of what the server status code received is or if the processor is configured to put the server response body in the request attribute. In the later configuration a request FlowFile with the response body in the attribute and a typical response FlowFile will be emitted to their respective relationships.
value.name: Always Output Response

value.description: Bypass the normal truststore hostname verifier to allow the specified remote hostname as trusted. Enabling this property has MITM security implications, use wisely. Will still accept other connections based on the normal truststore hostname verifier. Only valid with SSL (HTTPS) connections.
value.name: Trusted Hostname

value.description: Enabling this property saves all the response headers to the original request. This may be when the response headers are needed but a response is not generated due to the status code received.
value.name: Add Response Headers to Request

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception. It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: No Retry

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the success of the request.
relationships.name: Original

relationships.description: A Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). If the 'Output Response Regardless' property is true then the response will be sent to this relationship regardless of the status code received.
relationships.name: Response

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Retry

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A JsonPath expression that indicates the array element to split into JSON/scalar fragments.
value.name: JsonPath Expression

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: If a FlowFile fails processing for any reason (for example, the FlowFile is not valid JSON or the specified path does not exist), it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile that was split into segments. If the FlowFile fails processing, nothing will be sent to this relationship
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: All segments of the original FlowFile will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: split

value.description: Name of the ES cluster (for example, elasticsearch_brew). Defaults to 'elasticsearch'
value.name: Cluster Name

value.description: ElasticSearch Hosts, which should be comma separated and colon for hostname/port host1:port,host2:port,.... For example testcluster:9300.
value.name: ElasticSearch Hosts

value.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only app
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The ping timeout used to determine when a node is unreachable. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s
value.name: ElasticSearch Ping Timeout

value.description: Node sampler interval. For example, 5s (5 seconds) If non-local recommended is 30s
value.name: Sampler Interval

value.description: The name of the attribute containing the identifier for each FlowFile
value.name: Identifier Attribute

value.description: The name of the index to insert into
value.name: Index

value.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)
value.name: Type

value.description: The preferred number of FlowFiles to put to the database in a single transaction
value.name: Batch Size

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the database cannot be updated but attempting the operation again may succeed
relationships.name: retry

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the regular expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters a given capture group value can have. Any characters beyond the max will be truncated.
value.name: Maximum Capture Group Length

value.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.
value.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence

value.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?i).
value.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?x).
value.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?s).
value.name: Enable DOTALL Mode

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.
value.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the begining or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).
value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?u).
value.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding

value.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?U).
value.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

value.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.
value.name: Include Capture Group 0

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A JsonPath expression that indicates the array element to split into JSON/scalar fragments.
value.name: JsonPath Expression

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: If a FlowFile fails processing for any reason (for example, the FlowFile is not valid JSON or the specified path does not exist), it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile that was split into segments. If the FlowFile fails processing, nothing will be sent to this relationship
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: All segments of the original FlowFile will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: split

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: Generates 'bins' of FlowFiles and fills each bin as full as possible. FlowFiles are placed into a bin based on their size and optionally their attributes (if the <Correlation Attribute> property is set)

Combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. If using this strategy, all FlowFiles must have the attributes <fragment.identifier>, <fragment.count>, and <fragment.index> or alternatively (for backward compatibility purposes) <segment.identifier>, <segment.count>, and <segment.index>. All FlowFiles with the same value for "fragment.identifier" will be grouped together. All FlowFiles in this group must have the same value for the "fragment.count" attribute. All FlowFiles in this group must have a unique value for the "fragment.index" attribute between 0 and the value of the "fragment.count" attribute.

value.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge content. The 'Defragment' algorithm combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. The 'Bin-Packing Algorithm' generates a FlowFile populated by arbitrarily chosen FlowFiles
value.name: Merge Strategy

allowableValues.description: A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single TAR file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the TAR file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the TAR file. If a FlowFile has an attribute named <tar.permissions> that is 3 characters, each between 0-7, that attribute will be used as the TAR entry's 'mode'.

A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single ZIP file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the ZIP file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the ZIP file. The <Compression Level> property indicates the ZIP compression to use.
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 3 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 2 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 1 FlowFile Package
The contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile
The Avro contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile

value.description: Determines the format that will be used to merge the content.
value.name: Merge Format

value.description: Determines which FlowFile attributes should be added to the bundle. If 'Keep All Unique Attributes' is selected, any attribute on any FlowFile that gets bundled will be kept unless its value conflicts with the value from another FlowFile. If 'Keep Only Common Attributes' is selected, only the attributes that exist on all FlowFiles in the bundle, with the same value, will be preserved.
value.name: Attribute Strategy

value.description: If specified, like FlowFiles will be binned together, where 'like FlowFiles' means FlowFiles that have the same value for this Attribute. If not specified, FlowFiles are bundled by the order in which they are pulled from the queue.
value.name: Correlation Attribute Name

value.description: The minimum number of files to include in a bundle
value.name: Minimum Number of Entries

value.description: The maximum number of files to include in a bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Number of Entries

value.description: The minimum size of for the bundle
value.name: Minimum Group Size

value.description: The maximum size for the bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Group Size

value.description: The maximum age of a Bin that will trigger a Bin to be complete. Expected format is <duration> <time unit> where <duration> is a positive integer and time unit is one of seconds, minutes, hours
value.name: Max Bin Age

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of bins that can be held in memory at any one time
value.name: Maximum number of Bins

allowableValues.description: The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be retrieved from the contents of a file
The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be specified as property values

value.description: Determines if Header, Footer, and Demarcator should point to files containing the respective content, or if the values of the properties should be used as the content.
value.name: Delimiter Strategy

value.description: Filename specifying the header to use. If not specified, no header is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Header File

value.description: Filename specifying the footer to use. If not specified, no footer is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Footer File

value.description: Filename specifying the demarcator to use. If not specified, no demarcator is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Demarcator File

value.description: Specifies the compression level to use when using the Zip Merge Format; if not using the Zip Merge Format, this value is ignored
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: If using the Zip or Tar Merge Format, specifies whether or not the FlowFiles' paths should be included in their entry names; if using other merge strategy, this value is ignored
value.name: Keep Path

relationships.description: If the bundle cannot be created, all FlowFiles that would have been used to created the bundle will be transferred to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The FlowFile containing the merged content
relationships.name: merged

relationships.description: The FlowFiles that were used to create the bundle
relationships.name: original

value.description: The size of the file that will be used
value.name: File Size

value.description: The number of FlowFiles to be transferred in each invocation
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: Specifies whether the data should be Text or Binary
value.name: Data Format

value.description: If true, each FlowFile that is generated will be unique. If false, a random value will be generated and all FlowFiles will get the same content but this offers much higher throughput
value.name: Unique FlowFiles

value.description: Name of the ES cluster (for example, elasticsearch_brew). Defaults to 'elasticsearch'
value.name: Cluster Name

value.description: ElasticSearch Hosts, which should be comma separated and colon for hostname/port host1:port,host2:port,.... For example testcluster:9300.
value.name: ElasticSearch Hosts

value.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only app
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The ping timeout used to determine when a node is unreachable. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s
value.name: ElasticSearch Ping Timeout

value.description: Node sampler interval. For example, 5s (5 seconds) If non-local recommended is 30s
value.name: Sampler Interval

value.description: The name of the attribute containing the identifier for each FlowFile
value.name: Document Identifier Attribute

value.description: The name of the index to read from
value.name: Index

value.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)
value.name: Type

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the document cannot be fetched but attempting the operation again may succeed
relationships.name: retry

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.name: File Size

value.description: The number of FlowFiles to be transferred in each invocation
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: Specifies whether the data should be Text or Binary
value.name: Data Format

value.name: Document Identifier Attribute

value.description: The name of the index to read from
value.name: Index

value.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)
value.name: Type

relationships.name: failure

relationships.name: retry

relationships.name: success

value.description: HTTP request method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS). Arbitrary methods are also supported. Methods other than POST and PUT will be sent without a message body.
value.name: HTTP Method

value.description: Remote URL which will be connected to, including scheme, host, port, path.
value.name: Remote URL

value.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL (https) connections.
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Max wait time for connection to remote service.
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: Max wait time for response from remote service.
value.name: Read Timeout

value.description: Include an RFC-2616 Date header in the request.
value.name: Include Date Header

value.description: Follow HTTP redirects issued by remote server.
value.name: Follow Redirects

value.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers. Also any dynamic properties set will be sent as headers. The dynamic property key will be the header key and the dynamic property value will be interpreted as expression language will be the header value.
value.name: Attributes to Send

value.description: The username to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL. Cannot include control characters (0-31), ':', or DEL (127).
value.name: Basic Authentication Username

value.description: The password to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.
value.name: Basic Authentication Password

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

value.description: If set, the response body received back will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.
value.name: Put Response Body In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: If routing the response body to an attribute of the original (by setting the "Put response body in attribute" property or by receiving an error status code), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.
value.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: Whether to communicate with the website using Digest Authentication. 'Basic Authentication Username' and 'Basic Authentication Password' are used for authentication.
value.name: Digest Authentication

value.description: Will force a response FlowFile to be generated and routed to the 'Response' relationship regardless of what the server status code received is or if the processor is configured to put the server response body in the request attribute. In the later configuration a request FlowFile with the response body in the attribute and a typical response FlowFile will be emitted to their respective relationships.
value.name: Always Output Response

value.description: Bypass the normal truststore hostname verifier to allow the specified remote hostname as trusted. Enabling this property has MITM security implications, use wisely. Will still accept other connections based on the normal truststore hostname verifier. Only valid with SSL (HTTPS) connections.
value.name: Trusted Hostname

value.description: Enabling this property saves all the response headers to the original request. This may be when the response headers are needed but a response is not generated due to the status code received.
value.name: Add Response Headers to Request

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception. It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: No Retry

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the success of the request.
relationships.name: Original

relationships.description: A Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). If the 'Output Response Regardless' property is true then the response will be sent to this relationship regardless of the status code received.
relationships.name: Response

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Retry

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success
